segments.title: Azul Zulu Builds of OpenJDK
segments.content: Azul Zulu builds of OpenJDK are open source, TCK-tested and certified builds of OpenJDK. Azul Zulu is available for a wide range of hardware platforms and operating systems. The Azul Zulu Documentation includes release notes, an installation guide, and third-party licenses. Here you can find everything you need to know to successfully install and manage Azul Zulu. Release Notes Third Party Licenses Azul Commercial Compatibility Kit

segments.title: Installing Optimizer Hub on AWS Elastic Kubernetes Service
segments.section: Setting Up an External Load Balancer
segments.content: Setting Up an External Load Balancer If you need to connect to Optimizer Hub from outside the Kubernetes cluster, you need to setup up a load balancer in front of the gateway instances: To set up a load balancer, please follow AWS documentation regarding load balancer controller setup.
